page.title: 01THE BIRDLIP AREA
page.content: Our block lies on the western edge of the Cotswold escarpment above the city of Gloucester. Most of the land is farmed to produce crops and livestock. Three dairy farms have given up this year because of the change in Common Market policy. Some of the land is so steep on the western edge of the block that it cannot be used even for farming. The main A417 Gloucester-Cirencester Road (Roman "Ermine Street") passes through the block. Tourists stop on the main road at Barrow Wake to enjoy the fine views over the Severn Vale and Gloucester towards the Malvern Hills and the mountains of Wales. The only village in the block is Birdlip.
